content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												Easily one of the best indie games of recent years. If not one of the best Turn-based RPGs of all time. Speaking as someone who has never played a traditional turn-based RPG prior to finding this game on Kongregate years ago (Unless Mario RPG counts, which i don't think it does.) I can therefore say that this game is a PERFECT gateway RPG. Just enough depth in it's combat system to make vetrans feel welcome, while not alienating newcomers like alot of other RPGS do (Xenoblade and Final Fantasy X come to mind)The gameplay (once it gets rolling) consists of 3 party members (with 1 in backup). Anna is the support class with her basic attacks not doing all to much damage but having alot of skills to debuff enemies or inflict them with bad statuses.Matt is the physical attacker, with alot of non-elemental high power skills.Natillie is the Magic user / Healer with most of her power revolving around her ability to deal elemental damage or heal/revive part memebers.Lance is the glass canon with not much defence or HP, but with a ton of enemy devestating moves.When you complete battles, you gain EXP and money (In this case, Choclate Coins) like other RPGs. You also gain AP which can be used to level up or learn new Skills or SpecialsThe difference between Skills and Specials is that Skills are character specific, whereas Specials consist of a pool that multiple characters can learn from. Each special can only be learnt by one party member. This makes for some intresting strategic opertunities as alot of arts are here. This game also has Limit Breaks, which to be honest, are not that much different than in Final Fantasy 7. But for those of you unfamilliar, Limit Breaks are powerful attacks that can only be used once a character has taken enough damage. What's different here, however, is that limit breaks can be saved for later use as the attack command is still there, where as to do so in Final Fantasy 7, you would need to keep using Magic instead of attacking.The equipment system in this game is in my opinion the best type of equipment system in any RPG. No 2 pieces of equipment are exactly the same, nor are there any that are inherently better than other pieces. They all have their own use with their own stats and resistances. I cannot think of any other RPG where i was never like "Oh, this sword does more damage than that sword with no downsides. Better sell my old sword for this upgraded one"The music is annother shining point of this game. Phyrnna did an amazing job. Explaining it can't do it justice, so i suggest you listen to it for yourself.Overall, 10/10. If you are looking for annother good RPG that isn't too confusing to get into, look no furher than Epic Battle Fantasy 4.

content:
Posted: April 7
												I bought this game from the Overwhelmingly Positive Humble Bundle for 1€.I can't believe i'm writing a review of this game on Steam after playing EBF2 on Newgrounds in 2009. Time flies.What is this game about? How the description on the store page says, this is a turn based rpg with cute graphics and stupid humor, how i like it. At first the gameplay seems simple but the game tells you from the first battle to scan every enemies because elemental weakness and resistances are the core of this game.The game gives you a lot of equipment because to succeed you need to change your gear before starting an encounter or between waves to not be overwhelmed by your opponents. This is a good layer of strategy alongside the usual buff your party and debuff your enemies.This brings another point i liked of this game, the forging. It's quite simple here, you need to have the materials acquired by slaying enemies or bought by stores to increase the atrritubutes of your gear and some also have passives like random chance to summon a belly flopping mammoth on an enemy each turn, auto cast buffs on your party or a damaging spell after attacking. So try equip and upgrade different piece of gear for some nice combos, don't focus on what looks the best!The plot is quite simple and funnily enough it serves just as a background for our "heroes" to adventure on the map and acquire gear while doing stupid stuff. That's the charm of this series, the party is a bunch of goofballs with barely working brains. As Anna said: "I have no idea how they survived this long with no survival skills". Quite a different tone from your usual RPG.Finally, the soundtrack, which is free by the way, is really good. It set up the pace perfectly with happy tunes while exploring the grass areas or fighting the early enemies, to dark tones in the toughest fights. The composer is really good and she made EBF3 music too, check that out!Now, after praising basically everything, i will nitpick a couple of complains. First of all, some fights will drag a lot, expecially on higher difficulties, where the stats of enemies are increased, and when i saw an encounter was composed of 7 waves i was already rolling my eyes after finishing another long wave or a boss fight. I don't think it's boring, but i tended to overthink my strategy and equip for each wave and probably my brain was melting.Second problem is that the game offers 4 characters, but unfortunatly it's best to focus on 3 and two slots are occupied by Matt (warrior) and Nat (Mage) for their highly specialized stats so the third slot is contested by Lance (Gunner) and Anna (Archer) that overlap a bit on their utility but many guides and myself went with Anna in the end since she is the newcomer and brings a bit more on the table than Lance (cough, evasion buff).To conclude my fanboy review, i say this game gave me more than 30 hours of enjoyment for just 1€, and i plan to play   new game+ on Epic difficulty, but i can say that i should have bought this earlier, even at full price (11€.... not a lot) because it's a bargain for someone that enjoyed in his youth Final Fantasy and other turn based rpgs in the PSX era. Just don't let the "anime" graphic, "childish" humor and flash coding influence your opinion on this game.If you aren't sure, you can play this for free on Kongregate or Newgrounds, the only thing you will miss is Battle Mountain, another end game with extra loot, but unrelated to the main quest, so you aren't missing any plot by not playing it. So you also have a demo, what more do you want?! :DNow, i'm waiting for EBF5, currently in development, and this time i will get it as soon as possible.TL. DR. game is good!

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 3, 2014
												Great fun->I usually skip over all types of round-bases-battle-RPGs but I'm glad I made an exception here. EBF4 is a tongue-in-cheek RPG with hilarious characters who dress as stereotypical pirates, rangers or red mages. On the over-world map you collect hidden goodies, explore branching ways and follow the farce of a storyline. If you choose to bump into an enemy the fighting starts, no tedious random encounters after any x steps. Also heroes slowly heal after battle for convenience and most creatures respawn.The battle system isn't boring but really fun with lots of different skills, weapons, equipment, usable items. Skills are unlocked and upgraded with skill points. Levels are gained by experience. Weapons and Armor are found or bought in shops and upgraded with items. There are also summons usable by anyone, limit breaks and "specials" which are skills you can assign to complement a characters skill set like a fire attack or a heal spell.You may try out the EBF game series on some websites for free to understand how the game works.

												crazy good game considering it was developed mostly by one guy. has everything that makes indie rpgs good including: rad music straight outta newgrounds clever references to games as old as ff1 and as new as minecraft really good animation and art everywhere gear upgrades from loot enemies are very well designed and its easy to tell their strengths and weaknesses just by looking at them grind/gear curve is perfect very easy to influence game difficultyit does have its problems though, mostly due to being ported from flash. moving the mouse anywhere on screen drops the FPS to 1 (known bug) and the game starts dropping a bunch of frames after playing for a couple of hours (only fix is restarting game). there's also no controller support which is sad but still not a gamebreaker.if you want a fun indie "by weebs, for weebs" rpg that doesn't require much commitment (and you've already played neptunia), support scottish developers and get this. it's a good deal at the base price and at 50% off you're robbing the poor guy.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2015
												I've had nothing but a good time playing this game.It's a JRPG style turn based combat game, with an overworld map exploration aspect to it (secrets to be found, items that open up new areas and paths usually to treasure in old areas).There are no random encounters, and only optional enemies respawn; once you clear a 'path-blocking' encounter it remains cleared.  Turn-based combat with a focus on using skills/spells that the enemies are weak to, with a party-wide 'summon meter', lots of items and equipment to be had all with varying effects to them such as "randomly summons a wooly mammoth to fall from the sky onto an enemy each round", "randomly blesses the character", "counters attacks with xxxxx skill" things like that.The humor in the character/NPC dialogs is light hearted if a bit geared towards a younger crowd (not kids though).Fans of turn based RPGs should give this one a shot, it's very easy to play in short bursts when you feel that RPG itch, or you can get 30+ hours out of it like I have so far!

content:
Posted: February 13, 2016
												A game that doesn't look great but is rated 98% on Steam, uh..? Okay, let's try the Flash version... Ah, the agony, you have to point and click to move the character around, they're moving on a grid and you get ugly icons everywhere you point at... My, my. The character designs aren't exactly good... Okay, since these are both one-man projects, I'll at least say that it looks much better than Undertale. It also beats it in terms of laughs and overall complexity.Really. It's absolutely hilarious, and also excrutiatingly overwhelming at the beginning of the game. Ah, those crafting materials...!After an hour I decided to buy the Steam version, and couldn't stop playing it ever since. This is nothing like a RPG Maker game, it seems to use its very own engine (which, amusingly, is quite slow even on a high-end PC... Thankfully it's still playable). This has a lot of advantages.It pays respects to its elders but never tries to be lazy about anything. My main complaint? It's a very difficult game... If you want to 100% it, you'll suffer. A lot. Be prepared to spend tens of hours on it. I'll just be happy with at least two thirds of the achievements. If you don't mind not getting everything, then... I get it's doable. But you'll still need to grind a lot, or use a money cheat to buy all of the items you need.And this was my 42nd Steam review, a milestone for any self-respecting geek. Not my finest hour, though!

number of helpful: 37 of 72 people (51%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 25, 2014
												I know what you're thinking. "This guy hasn't even started playing this game yet, why should I listen to his review?"Well, the truth is, I played the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of this game's free version on Kongregate.  I also played the♥♥♥♥♥♥of EPF3.  And let me tell you, if there is any game on Kongregate that deserves to make it to the big time, its EPF4.Epic Battle Fantasy 4 once again stars the trio of heroic, yet dimwitted adventurers Matt, Natalie and Lance.  This time, however, they're joined by a new character, the ranger Anna, who is easily the smartest of the bunch.  Together, the four this time must travel across the land, searching for crystals and uncovering clues about a new feline menace.Epic Battle Fantasy has always prided itself on gut busting comedy and intense, over the top action, and this game is no exception.  There are hundreds of weapons, skills and summons to collect and use against literally hundreds of enemies, and the game is full of tongue in cheek moments such as Nat's oftentimes futile efforts to get Matt and Lance to care about the environment, or Anna trying to curb Matt's kleptomaniac tendencies.Also, is case you're wondering why you should buy this version, well, its because it grants you access to the Premium Pack.  This pack adds a ton of new content to the game, including new weapons, new armor, new summons, new enemies and bosses, and even an entirely new area.If you're a fan of turn based rpgs, of self-referential comedy, or just plain fun RPGs, then you owe it to yourself to try this out.  Check out the free version on Kongregate, and if you enjoy it, you should definitely considering going Premium by buying the Steam version.

content:
Posted: July 5, 2016
												Honestly this game is really good and was worth the ten bucks. I'm 17 hours in and still haven't beat it so there's definetely quite a bit of content here. The enemies all look different, yet are distinct to their element. The art all and all is very good, with limit breaks giving you these fun crazy destructive attacks. There is a bit of grinding and the combat is turn based, so if you don't like turn based combat this game isn't for you. The grind is pretty minimal and throughout the story are the fairly generic characters making funny remarks and conversation to keep you interested, but there isn't any award winning plot here, as the game doesn't take itself seriuosly, but that gives it creative freedom for some funny moments to keep it more fun than serious.                So overall this game is 8/10 which for 10 bucks is pretty good. It probably wont last more than 20 hours for most people though because I'm basically at the end, but overall I enjoyed it and I think it's pretty good. You can try the game out in the browser if you'd like to see if you enjoy it first, but the steam version has WAY more content and is definetely worth it if you like games from KupoGames. If this game is on sale for less than 5 bucks like it is at the time of the review, I'd say definetely get it if you're into this genre.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												This is a standard RPG with its selling point probably being its humor. It's pretty addicting.The two best things about this game:- When you get a medal, notifications appear on your steam client, the game itself (satisfying sound effect included), and if you have ASTATS open in your browser in the background, it'll appear there, too.- What's even better, is when in game, you're fighting an enemy and it barely lived as your turn ended, then it gets struck by lightning and dies, ending the battle. Or even better, it gets crushed by a falling mammoth out of nowhere. Or two of them.If you feel that's underwhelming, maybe this isn't for you. I recommend you play the free flash games, Epic Battle Fantasy 1~4, to see how you like it before buying it. They're on Kongregate and other flash game sites.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												This game is undoubtedly one of the best flash games I played. The amount of work done to this game is phenomenal. I remember playing this on Kongregate and enjoying the hell out of it. Once I heard that the full version of the game was selling on steam, I told myself that I had to buy this. AND I played through the whole thing, including through all of the additional contents with Battle Mountain! Here's why this game is worth a look!POSITIVES:- HOURS of content- Not so serious story with humorous elements of characters- Four characters to play as (Each with unique skills)- Many ways to customize characters (Skills, Costumes, Badges)- Several areas to explore and tons of foes to face!- Game presents a challenge and difficulty scales gradually- Many RPG elements that people who are familiar OR new to them will love- Many rewards, many prizes!- Don't need to grind this game in order to beat it. From what I remember correctly, enemies scale to your level.- SOUNDTRACK IS AMAZING!- Art design of world and characters are attractive- Can save your game anytime- ACHIEVEMENTS!NEGATIVES:- No gripping or remarkable story- For people who do not like casual RPGs, this is not your cup of teaOverall, I enjoyed playing through this game again and experiencing the challenge of Battle Mountain! Hope this review helps make a clear picture of Epic Battle Fantasy 4!

content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
												EBF originates from a internet flash game which I originally played years ago on Newgrounds. It's a turn-based adventure RPG with elements from its counterparts in both western RPGs and JRPGs.As far as RPGs go, it has a relatively small amount of gameplay, making it a short (but in my opinion sweet) play. Most of the fun will be had in battles, where diverse enemies and an easy-to-understand element system make it a strangely relaxing experience. The art is nice, the moves are diverse and there are references everywhere to almost anything.Its cheap too, so thats a plus.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												I'm known to HATE turn-based combat, but the Epic Battle Fantasy Series is the exception. I don't know what it is about the games that makes me love them to bits... I guess it's the characters and the wholeheartedness of it all. What I feel: Kupo wants to make these games for the love of making them. Also, you can't say that the characters haven't had any development. I remember how Lance joined the team (not in EBF4) - which was hilarious. Then there's Anna who learned to tolerate Matt's love to ste- err, take "Free Samples" whenever he wants. A love development can really complicate the narrative if mis-handled, so please be careful and don't rush it!My bit of critic, I.E. the only problem I had: wave transitions are cruel. Q.Q;Maybe it's intentional, but once all the enemies attack then they all die of poison or whatever, the next enemies come in and they get to go first. Also, if the last (and only) enemy attacks and then die from a counter attack, I start hating my characters' awesomeness since I have to deal with the next wave's attacks before I can heal or something. It'd be great if that were dealt with. :DThat's literally my only complaint, with the first sentence in mind, so YES! Get it and play it! Totally worth it!Lastly: I love the reference to Golden Sun. >.>

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												This, my fine gaming siblings, is what we've all been waiting for. Addicting turn-based classic JRPG gameplay. an amazing soundtrack that gets you in the mood to fight when entering a battle, and let's you jam out as you travel. Funny and interesting characters that you grow to love (and laugh at) instantly. A myriad of spells, skills, weapons, armor, power-ups, enemies, dungeons, landscapes, and slightly... *ahem* "special" (yet hilarious) NPCs. An artstyle with animations that instantly pique your inner otaku and hold you captive. And last, but not least, and interesting and engaging storyline that will have you on the edge of your seat (perhaps exagerated, but i digress). Everything about this game screams that it was carefully and lovingly developed by a AAA team of a godly design. But not so, as it is meticulously crafted by one man who has spent years on these games. Perhaps it is free elsewhere, but i implore that you consider helping out this fellow, by throwing a few dollars his way. It is easily worth the money. Now, go forth my brothers and sisters. Go forth and conquer that which is Epic Battle Fantasy 4. Because if this isn't a 10/10 masterpiece, then nothing is.

content:
Posted: March 4, 2014
												In short - this game is absolutely awesome.In long... Challenging yet not impossible, funny yet smart - it keeps you playing, but never lets you get bored. Personally I find fighting mechanics extremely enjoyable - well balanced, but requiring some level of skill to end up effective and successful. Storyline is nice, though I liked it more in EBF3 - there were more fun stuff and I really loved all those witty anime refferals. I want to point out - that in EBF4 quality level DID NOT drop, it's just that now such things are expected (for those who played previous part obviously). Characters are great - they are not one bit like classic boring "heroic" heroes or angsty anime kids. Well... there are some problems - Lance with his naz... black uniform does look a bit disturbing. I just don't understand authors position on this one. So I picked different outfit and tried to forget. =) And did I say Natalie got some classy eyes, -wink -wink?!  I recommend this game to everyone...  unless you find Final Fantasy style of battle system unaccepatable. If so - accept my condolences!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
												Epic Battle Fantasy is a story set in a fantasy land that encapsulates total humour. It's powerful role playing essentials prove that an RPG does not have to be made with great graphics or new complicated battle mechanics - it just needs a firm storyline such as this.The story unfolds with four heroes that find each other along the journey, fight monsters, and as usual, attempt to claim world peace from this unseemingly harmless boss - the Godcat. Throughout the way, dry R16 humour develops throughout the story, and even when you are engaging in difficult battles, somewhat the characters randomly crack jokes in a light hearted manner. Hmm...The system is brilliant. Brilliant in the sense that the forging and money systems go hand-in-hand nicely unlike many other games that introduce poverty into the heroes. Summons actually help a lot, and battle statuses are not just those nice symbols floating on your heads - they actually kill you. Simple but effective.Music is fine, although the tunes are reminiscent of popular music. Canon in D - main theme. Enjoyable but I didn't love it as much and it somewhat did not match the situations.Overall, a must try for fantasy fans. Also has a very high replay value.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												I followed this series back in 2009 (starting from EBF 1) and am still following it.This game was first introduced on a flash game website and to have it ported to my personal PC is the nicest thing to have.The game is a simple RPG with a linear story line. Tons of unique (even fanmade!) monsters as well as an abundance of costumization for your characters to use. Each enemy has their weakness and each character is good at dealing certain types of damage or being a certain type of "stereotype" role.Epic Battle Fantasy is a homage to your good ol' JRPG (Japanese Role-Playing Game) and features a keyboard usage as well as mouse usage, depending on what your preference is. The EBF series also has a lot of connections (and easter eggs!)  with Japanese stuff related, especially anime. For those who want a simple, yet fun RPG with tons of references to anime, J-games, this game will be fun for you!The creator is also creating on a sequel of EBF 5 and spin-off bullet hell versions. Also check out EBF III, the prequel of this game! :D

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												This game is a blast from the past for me, and I'm very happy it's on Steam. It's a fun little Flash RPG, with silly humor and goofy battles, but with incredibly solid mechanics. The battles are fun and satisfying, and can also be pretty challenging on max difficulty. The only issues I feel are worth mentioning are the following two: the character balancing, and the graphics. It's not that the graphics are bad, I rather like the art style. But when you try to play on fullscreen, it lags like crazy, even on higher end PC's. As for character balance, it's hard to ensure all party members remain relevant throughout the game. In my experience, it's typical for people to settle on the three they like most and just roll with them the whole game. While this isn't really a bad thing, I think it would just be more interesting for each character to be built for a certain role, and perhaps to have all 4 fighting at the same time. Regardless, this game is very well made and I loved it long before it ever won any awards (which is hasn't, shamefully!), which is why I nominated it. Great work Matt, Looking forward to EBF 5!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												Considering this is not only a (loving) parody of JRPGs, but was also originally a Flash game, this game is somehow really amazing. The turn-based battles are pretty simple, but the summoning system and being able to swap in a backup character - even when the one you're swapping out is dead- is a nice change. And the variety of weapons, armor, and accessories give a ton of options to tackling enemies. Then there's the fact that they can all be upgraded to be even more useful. The art style is simple too, but also pretty clean and nice to look at. Basically, it won't turn any heads, but this game is technically several years old from the time of Kongregate. The characters all look really nice and have a lot of charm, especially in their idle animations that love to add in a few fun references. And the characters themselves also have some fun personalities and banter. I really only wish that there was a little more development involved in it.Next up is the music, which is very fun-sounding and doesn't get tiring to listen to. And considering the soundtrack is free, its definitely worthwhile. The only real complaint I have is that the tracks themselves don't seamlessly loop like you would expect, so it's pretty obvious when they do.One of the biggest differences from the original browser version is the addition of Battle Mountain, a side world with extra-tough battles. And grinding isn't an option since levels scale (but try to come back later with more skills). It's a nice addition that will keep you coming back for a challenge, in addition to the game's already solid level of content. This game is overall a fun experience, that while a bit dated, can still bring some chuckles and enjoyment. So play it if you like simple turn-based RPGs.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 24, 2016
												So lemme just get some facts and biases straight.The first game I ever played from Matt was Brawl Royale - a simple flash game that's basically just a reflex game to see how fast you can press a button when prompted. The animation, for me at the time, was pretty dang good and he gained a fan from that moment on. I've played every other game that came out since then, other than the Bullet Heaven ones, and I loved all of them.If you ever get to read this, Matt, I gotta say thanks for entertaining me for all these years. Hopefully, EBF5 will blow EBF4 right out the water.Tl;dr - I'm a fanboy and this review may be a little biased. Also, this is my first ever review.NOW ON TO THE REVIEW!REVIEW:This game was originally a flash game that was (and still is) free to play on sites such as Kongregate and Newgrounds. The only real differences between the free version and the Steam one/Kongregate's premium one are the additional weapons, armors, and badges and Battle Mountain. This is a little underwhelming for something worth $12 dollars, I have to admit.If you've played any traditional JRPG games before, that's pretty much what this game plays like. This may be a turn-off for some, but for fans and newcomers to the genre, I think you'll be in for a treat.The characters are all unique and interesting in their own way - even the NPCs, while not really memorable, have some choice bits of dialogue. As for the dialogue and text in the game, it's very humorous with loads of little nods and jabs to all things video games.The plot is pretty linear, so NG+ is really only for maxing out whatever skill you didn't learn and trying out some new tactics....That's all I can think of at the moment while typing this up so...Overall, 8.5/10 - needs more boobs

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												The "overwhelmingly positive" review score makes me think of the first Dim-Sum restaurant to recieve a Michelin star. That is to say it's not the most extravagant or artistic game, but an expert execution of some basic JRPG principles. I've already played it from start to finish for free online, and felt it was worth actually buying. From a replayability standpoint the humor and plot obviously doesn't hold up well, but the combat is still engrossing, and what more can you ask of something titled "Epic Battle Fantasy"? The soundtrack is shockingly good in a nostalgic synthisizer sort of way, and though the tracks loop fairly heavily after 11 hours and counting I haven't muted it yet. The most impressive part for me is the level design. From start to finish you are never asked to backtrack without being rewarded for it. Exploration is heavily encouraged, and plot based roadblocks flow exceptionally nicely and naturally. Like Morrowind each 'tile' of the map is filled with side-quests and secrets to discover.

content:
Posted: May 1, 2014
												*Revised* Old review can be found here: http://pastebin.com/gT51U0zYLike JRPG combat but hate the melodramatic stories or overtly anime plots that only appeal to otakus?Want a RPG that's honest to god funny without pointing out all the cliches we see in RPGs? Epic Battle Fantsy 4 is for you! With a deep combat system that's very much based off Final Fantasy, but with enough nuances to make it its own and an interesting equipment system that allows for more replayability, unlike in most RPGs, one sword or peice of armor isn't "better" than others simply cause you find it later in the game, each have their own pros and cons that allows for extra experimentation and strategy. Oh and the music is pretty great too, not the best in the world but is definitely worth a listen.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												Boy, did I strike gold when I picked up Epic Battle Fantasy 4.  New to the series I had no Idea what I was getting myself in to, but it quickly found a warm and fuzzy place in this avid RPG fan's heart. The art style in this game offers a fun, playful experience, keeping well away from the dark and gritty with generous amounts of color to satisfy everyones pallet.  The Soundtrack. MY GOD THE SOUNDTRACK is what makes this game for me. The various battle themes keep you pumped from start to finish and with every new zone comes its own thrilling and whimsical theme tune that serenades you on your fantasy adventure and well after that. Going by the music and game design alone, it is clear that the developers and those involved in this humble indie game have a  clear understanding of both fun and fantasy. The ammount of  hours you can get out of this game is up to you. With an endless supply of monsters showing up in previously explored areas, you can level your characters as much or as little as you like. The enviroment puzzles, although optional will keep you busy and reward you fairly.  Oh and feel free to grind materials and upgrade your gear for  even more of an edge in battle.  And I can confidently say this game has plenty of replayability, the main story is short and sweet and wont run the risk of boring you halfway through your second, even third playthrough. You have some control over what abilities your characters learn or not, and mixing up the gear and permenant upgrades to your characters stats can certainly effect their roles and the outcome of battles. Plus multiple difficulty settings for all your bragging-rights needs!A damn fine Fantasy RPG that will amaze, inspire and reward your efforts with equal affection. Guaranteed satisfaction 10/10

content:
Posted: March 6, 2016
												I wanted an old-style ff-esque game.  This is that game.  It has an overworld scrolling map like the original zelda, along with the ability to avoid random encounters.  The backtracking to grab items is handled well in items you find throughout the game unlocking easy access to already explored areas.  The puzzles make you think from time to time, and are solvable without having to look up a solution online.  The only thing I wish I had done was make better use of all the different weaponry and items.  It's easy to just level up your favorite items and miss out on some great combat tactics.I got the game on sale, but I think this game is well worth the normal asking price.  If the author creates and epic battle fantasy 5, I will definitely be a buyer.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
												Almost to the end of the story, I think. I love jrpgs and there aren't that many good ones on Steam or the PC for that matter. But then there is EBF4. The story isn't much to write home about but it's still cute and the writing is pretty humorous with tons of references to other classic games.  The world is pretty big and each area is unique and has plenty of different types of monsters. Crafting is simple and straightforward but satisfying and there are tons of skills to choose from.I have two very big complaints however. There is no controller support. Which is a shame because I wanted to sit back and relax whilst playing. The other complaint is the UI is a little cluttered. Even after hundreds of battles I can't remember which menu a specific skill is in but that's probably just because I'm dumb. Either way the game is well worth the money and I'm will be playing it any time I need to satisfy my jrpg urges.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												A must-buy, must-play game.I highly suggest playing the first Epic Battle Fantasy games (you can find those online) for the sake of the storyline and getting to know some of the characters.This game made me laugh out loud more than once with its fourth-wall breaking and really bad jokes. The gameplay itself is absolutely fantastic in every conceivable way. It's smooth, engaging, and there are a lot of challenges that'll keep you on your seat for a long, long time (from puzzles to bosses on Epic difficulty). The artwork is cute, and so is the plot. And finally, the characters are absolutely lovable and memorable, with each one having a unique (and sometimes unusual) personality.One of the best games I've ever played, and though it will probably not come out, I do hope that Matt creates an Epic Battle Fantasy 5. I really wanna get to know Anna more as a character, and I kinda wanna see some possibility of some relationships blooming!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 17, 2015
												( Review from a guy who usually play in French, sorry if this is hard to read )Really thought that the 3rd one was the best??? That nothing could have made this game any more perfect???Well here's the 4th game or this amazing serie.EBF4 is a classic-styled RPG : Turn by turn combats, Équipments, Magics, Element system, ALL the Items, Aventure!!!The game's tags already spoil it all, nothing new.There are only 2 things you find less often in that one game tho' :- Grinding.... ooooooh the grinding... very glad you didn't corrupt this game.- Random battles. Yes yes! YOU decide when the action scenes starts!The musics are amazing, so much i'm currently listening to them from the in-game gallery. Amazing idea to have more than one battle theme too, it prevents them to get repetitive too much.The game is funny and you might need a second playthough to spot and/or get all the references mentionned in the short but frequent character's lines.The game difficulty can be changed at will in the game's settings, so it's hard for me to give a negative point by saying that the Epic difficulty mode really can make you remember to save after every fight. Of course you could flee the battle and come back later if they are too strong for you... but really sometime you simply don't see the insta-death attack coming. Except for the bosses, the first 10 levels gives you short and enjoyable battles with basic tutorial windows that pop-up so new players aren't too lost. After you get to level 20-22 tho', battles can sometime get long and repetitive, especially with a high difficulty setting. Because the enemy monsters usually matches the current place you are in, it can happen that you just want to see some differant landscape in hope to see the foes also change accordingly... as you will stay in some specific 'biomes' for quite a few battles. The generous amount of ready-to-be-opened-gold-trimmed chests usually help you to not get too tired of these long 4-waves battles. The playable characters slightly lack some personality and backstory, yes, but i guess it's the perfect occasion for the 5th title to be even better that this one. Those who already played ( and loved ) the 3rd game should not see any problems with that tho'.The price is fair, and the game deserves every single of the 9 points I can give out of 10.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2015
												I honestly have a feeling that all the negative reviews are from people who've never even bothered playing the other 3 games and know nothing about the engine that was used for this or even gave it an actual chance. It wasn't RPGMaker so you obviously fail for trying to compare Kupo to a "reddit RPG Maker /b/tard". If anything since you know reddit so well that you used categories and seen for yourself how people are on there then you must be one of said "/b♥♥♥♥♥♥♥". This game is literally an indie RPG masterpiece referencing all types of games and genres and heavily Final Fantasy referenced. I played this mostly on Kongregate and the moment it was on Steam I bought it. The OST is AMAZING. I listen to it all the time at work. Halcyonic Falcon X aka Phyrnna <3 I love you <3. You can get all the EBF4 music on her YouTube or Spotify channels. Maybe Pandora, I don't know because I don't use Pandora. You can also get the soundtrack from the Steamapps folder of this game too. I've been a long time fan since EBF1 and Bulletheaven. I can't stress how awesome this game is for what it is. There's actually A LOT to do in it and you can easily upgrade EVERYTHING. However I'm missing like 1 piece of armor I think, I can't remember but I read something about it only being available at a certain time? I forgot the full details of it. It's a well known question a lot of people have been asking about in the game because they can't 100% the armor collection. Still haven't figured it out yet. The thing about this game is, if you want to speed through the game, you can change the games difficulty to easy. The only difference the game makes is the damage you receive from enemies and how much health they have. Basically just a stat difference. There isn't anything too significant unless you're trying to get all the achievements in-game. The game doesn't seem to give you extra rewards after battles, just the overall challenge of the fights. I usually find it easier when I'm trying to rush through the game to just set the game on easy until I get to a boss fight because a lot of the enemy fights tend to get pretty tedious over time the I crank up the difficulty to hard or something because I can't do epicyet and I'm on my second playthrough. This game does have pretty good replayability to it. Especially the fact that you need to clear the game 3 times in order to get the achievement. However that 5m damage achievement is insane. I can't seem to pull that off with the Revenge skill when everybody but Matt is dead and Matts near dead while atk buffed. I guess I just need to farm for atk stat boost items.I honestly give it a 9/10 for me only, because some of the non-boss battles can get really tedious and it does lose entertainment value after awhile. It's good to play this game for a few hours a day unless you decide to play on easy  the entire time until boss fights show up and crank up the difficulty.But in general I give this game a 10/10 just because of how well made it was by 1 man and how well the music is for the game by 1 woman. It's definitely a masterpiece indie RPG. I can't really find anything wrong with it in general. Just a few personal afflictions I had that shouldn't affect a lot of other people as much as me.

content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
												I freakin' love this game.  Before I get into the controversial stuff that I like... let me just say that the battle system in this game is amazing.  You can decide which characters get which special moves, you can level skills up that you want while leaving others in the dust if you choose, you have to level up your equipment (especially in later battles) to ensure you have a nice diverse set of resist gear to survive the challenging boss fights (depending on the difficulty you set it on).Did I mention that there are tons of hidden chests, quests for npcs (that aren't necessary for progression, just a bonus), an extra difficult bonus location for those of us that bought the game, and an amazing sound track?I personally really got a kick out of some of the commentary between the characters.  The story is obviously very light-hearted and the gimmicky chats between the heroes is usually comical - not to mention you can click on Natalie for a chuckle now and then.  Epic Battle Fantasy 4 for me was a breath of fresh air in a market that no longer caters to those of us who liked the traditional jrpg such as the early FF games/nes/snes rpgs of the past.  I like Skyrim and all of the clones of that new genre of rpg that are out, but I REALLY like the old style.  As someone who grew up in the 80s and 90s playing the rpgs of that time, and if you did too, you will like this game.  Thank you so much Kupo for putting this together, I just wish EBF5 was out...

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Wow this game is good.It is probably my favorite RPG of 2014.It's deep, it's solid and it is as easy or hard as you want it to be. Like Bravely Default you can switch difficulty at any time with no consequence. You can run from any battle everytime including boss battles, when you scan an enemy it stays scanned in future battles, items are clearly sorted based on type and effect, in-fact if you were to describe everything you hated about RPG's in the past 5 years, this game takes all of those things and removes them replacing them with something better. If I had one wish, it would be that the game was on a better engine with better presentation and that more people heard of this game because it is truely an underrated classic.Join Grumpy reviews for all your gaming needshttp://steamcommunity.com/groups/grumpyreviews

content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
												I freakin' love this game.  Before I get into the controversial stuff that I like... let me just say that the battle system in this game is amazing.  You can decide which characters get which special moves, you can level skills up that you want while leaving others in the dust if you choose, you have to level up your equipment (especially in later battles) to ensure you have a nice diverse set of resist gear to survive the challenging boss fights (depending on the difficulty you set it on).Did I mention that there are tons of hidden chests, quests for npcs (that aren't necessary for progression, just a bonus), an extra difficult bonus location for those of us that bought the game, and an amazing sound track?I personally really got a kick out of some of the commentary between the characters.  The story is obviously very light-hearted and the gimmicky chats between the heroes is usually comical - not to mention you can click on Natalie for a chuckle now and then.  Epic Battle Fantasy 4 for me was a breath of fresh air in a market that no longer caters to those of us who liked the traditional jrpg such as the early FF games/nes/snes rpgs of the past.  I like Skyrim and all of the clones of that new genre of rpg that are out, but I REALLY like the old style.  As someone who grew up in the 80s and 90s playing the rpgs of that time, and if you did too, you will like this game.  Thank you so much Kupo for putting this together, I just wish EBF5 was out...

content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												There is an achievement for stealing panties.10/10Edit: In all seriousness the humour isn't the only thing great about this game. Epic difficulty is very difficult and rewarding at the same time. There are some difficult puzzles. Late game (on epic) has some 30-60minute+ fights which are all or nothing - very tense, and very rewarding. Because of the way skills work there are some which you have to choose which character to take them on - i.e. revive which is only way besides using an item to actually revive a dead ally (which is pretty important since most attacks in the second half of the game are one shots).This remains one of the funniest, deep, and difficult games I have played ever. And if you are complaining about getting RNGed all the time - it's the kind of strategy which is beatable in all situations if you play it perfectly. The difficulty comes in devising a game plan and equipping the right items (which all do different things like random buffs). There are also multiple ways to build your party which can all work - a lot of people have Natz as a full carry mage for example, but she is on healer duty for me :)The only bad part of this game is the first boss where you have limited options because you have no skills yet :A

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
												Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is the latest game in the series of flash driven, turn based RPGs by Kupo Games. Its tiny development team, headed by Matt Roszak (Whom is credited for design, art, story and programming).This is a game which should be praised, for the amount of effort put in. The result is a well realised and full RPG experience full of character and heart.The game retains enough nostalgia from old school RPGs but still manages to feel fresh and new. If you’ve ever played any Final Fantasy title pre FFXI you’ll be familiar with this format. It gives a master class in how a turn based system should play along with all the usual elements you’d expect, being able to cast magic, summon other creatures, use items and attack and it does this as well as any JRPG does. Its appeal for me was that this is a finely tuned machine of a game. Usually with turn-based RPGs you eventually become so powerful that nothing is really a challenge, except maybe some bosses but with a combination of a difficulty slider that makes a difference and some well paced scaling of foes, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 keeps you on your toes and makes you think a little bit.I’ve always loved turn based RPGs when done well and RPGs in general, but turn based more so than Action. The reason being it brings an element of strategy with out reliance on quick time events [which i hate]. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 makes full use of the strategic element of the genre.It does this through its use of equipment and skills. The majority of weapons have an elemental effect which will assist you in tearing through enemies that are weak to that element and each piece of equipment has a use, without the collect and discard method used in most games. Weapons can be swapped out in combat also but this will take up a valuable turn to do so. Not only that, you won’t be receiving that free ride through an area.The skill and specials pool is a very well implemented way of customising your characters and their skillset. Skills can only be learned by that specific character and specials can be learned by all, but only one character may have it at any one time. Once again, brings some difficult decisions forward. You can also equip the characters with items that will provide passive bonuses or abilities within battle, another little customisable option for balancing your team some buffing characters and some casting abilities at dice-rolled intervals. Gone, in this game, is any idea of an “Ultimate” weapon. For me, that’s refreshing. Each weapon can be upgraded as you collect items from combat or treasure.The characters are well written and interact nicely. The personalities feel genuine and It seems like they are inspired by or based in some way on friends of the developer. At times they do act like close friends who have a lot of fun in each other’s company. This game is no doubt a labour of love and the small team at Kupo Games must have poured a lot of time into this game. It is increasingly rare to see triple-A games give this creative warmth, probably due to the size of the teams but Steam lets this flourish.There are a lot of small gestures and references that experienced RPG fans will appreciate showing a good dose of humour. From the snow covered Djinn from Golden Sun in Whitefall Town to the name of some of the achievements you can gain for using new items they flow through the whole game well.Epic Battle Fantasy’s achievement/medal system is well implemented. Some are very difficult to obtain, some pretty much laughing in the face at how ridiculous achievement systems are. When combined with the bestiary gives you that feeling of collection that a lot of games look past. It makes you want to collect them, this is important. A game by a turn-based RPG fan, for turn-based RPG fans, this will likely not appeal to those who only play Shooters or Wii Fit games but give it a chance and it may well draw you in. To wrap up, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is an absolutely fantastic game, made even more impressive by the huge contribution by Matt Roszak. It is a game i’ve played over the Christmas holidays and will likely play again soon. With a Newgame+ option it is set up well for this. The art is soft and friendly, the enemies range from menacing to adorable. The mechanics are solid, the story is well written, the characters engaging and the experience is enjoyable. It can also be bought for next to nothing because ‘Steam’.4 Ferrets out of 5

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												This is the first and probably one of the very few reviews I will bother doing - Because its rare for me to fidn a game I enjoy this much. I have been following Matt (Kupo, the creator)and playing his games for a few years now. Bullet Hell, EBF3, EBF4, and a few other titles. I have to say, this fourth installment of EBF is the best. The game gets better every single time. each game has more equipment, strategies, monster and boss variety, skills, and medals. There is no way to express how much I really enjoy this game. There are tons of light-hearted jokes, and meme references. Also, there are a ton of referneces from old school games and shows - especially pokemon. "Don't thing too hard - you may hit yourself in confusion." "IM NOT THAT DUMB."........" Weak generic bat enemy used wing attack!... It wasn't very effective." Littlle things like that (and there are tons of them) make this game so much more enjoyable. Also, Matt ridicules himself and the game several times through his characters. He doesn't take himself or the game too seriously, yet he makes every aspect of it near flawless. Its one of the few games I can actually sit through more than once and do it multiple times. Also, the ability to switch from easy to♥♥♥♥♥♥instantly is great. Some might think its cheap, but honestly, you only get achievements on epic... no need to fight 1000s of monsters that mean nothing on epic when on the bosses matter on that difficulty.ProsSkill varietyMonster varietyEquipment varietyStrategy (You will get crushed... especially on Epic difficulty... if you don't think before you act)HumorAchiements/medalsEndless monsters and challengesPuzzlesMultiple charactersTons of secrets and hidden chestsLots of questsGraphics (pretty intense for a flash game)Music (and they say video games don't have real music)New game+ and several difficulties, along with ability to switch difficulty whenever.Large map. Seemlessly merges together once you open all pathways. Lots to explore and discover.ConsSometimes choppy on steam. Probably not the game's fault. Plays fine on Kongregate.A lot of backtracking and memorizing. I personally don't mind this, but some might. There is a walkthrough for this game on kongregate if you cant find something or get stuck on a boss.10000/10.

Posted: September 13, 2014
												A lovely parody of classic RPGs like Final Fantasy, done in a memorable way. The dialogue is hilarious, and the art is wonderfully cartoony. I'm constantly discovering new things to do. And the story is surprisingly long for a flash game. I'm 10 hours in, and I haven't completed the game yet, having only just reached the final area. I highly recommend this game for any fans of RPGs, as well as anyone who loves a good laugh.

Posted: December 1, 2015
												Having almost finished the game, I'm more ambivalent about it now than when I started. The fights are fun and the puzzles are simple but plentiful, which is good, but the game's humour rapidly becomes tired and obvious. Boob jokes and casual lechery aren't just sexist and stupid, they're also dull and show a serious lack of creativity.I'm still recommending this game because the gameplay is good fun, but I recommend skipping through as much of the dialogue as you can, because it's just too boring to bother with.

content:
Posted: April 10, 2015
												Okay, so, theres three senarios on why you'd want this game:1. You completed the Free Flash Version [armorgames.com]And Wanted To Find Some More Adventure In The Same Game! And, Yes, This Is Extended - But Not Exactly How You'd Think.. (You May Not Have Completed It.)2. You Are An Epic Battle Fantasy Fan And Find It On Sale Here, Ready To Buy. You Didn't Play No.4, Yet Alone Know It Was On Steam, Or You Didn't Even Know No.4 Was Out!3. You Are Looking For A Decent RPG Game, Or A Friend Recommended It, And You Come Across This. You Would Have Purchased It Already If You Didn't Notice The Big Fat "4" Tag On It, Emplying Its A Further Installment In The Series And Had Such High Pricing, So You Look At Reviews.Well, I say  ALL  of the above is why you should get this game! To support the maker, To play a new game, and to have fun with a fresh game to you. The story is a continue from Epic Battle Fantasy Three,[armorgames.com] so I recommend playing that first. Maybe the characters will be a little knew even in that game, but you should get used to it. Even in number one the characters werent explained! Once you play that, get this game for:It has cute characters like kitten gods as your main foes, loot that you wouldnt find anywhere else, epic storyline, challenging puzzles, imagination behind the idea, RPG adventure, weapons of extroadinary looks, cutsences with emense artisrty, extended fights, major fun, enchanting music and more! I recommend this game for all of that. The exclusive content to the full PC release on steam are:• Includes Kongregate’s Premium Pack, which adds:•    8 new bosses, 27 new equips, 8 new skills.•    Huge new area to explore.•    Survival mode and boss rush challenges.•    Newgame+ feature, with higher level monsters.• Support for different window sizes and fullscreen resolutions.• Uncompressed audio and various visual improvements; the game looks and sounds better than ever.• Integration with Steam’s achievements, trading cards, and most importantly, cloud saving.• Includes the soundtrack. (26 tracks!)Added Awesomeness: 100%---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------And.The Cute Ones Deserve It!

												Wow, this game is fun... and big! I'm amazed it's just a Flash game. If you're a fan of the old-school Final Fantasy games, this game is for you, especially if you like cats. :3 It's very rewarding, too, since the visuals are fantastic, the writing is fun, and the battles are tense (especially toward the end). I can't count the number of times when I was sure I was going to lose, but I somehow managed to get it together just enough to crawl to victory.The final boss is the most tense battle I've ever fought in an RPG. The game does its best to kill you, but there's this tiny sliver of hope, and every turn feels like it will be your last. When victory finally comes, you will know it's because you tore it from the the maw of defeat with your bare hands.At least, that's how I felt. Hopefully, I'm not just bad. :P I'm sure I could have leveled up more, but the pacing of the game made it feel like this was where I was supposed to be, and that feeling persists through the entire game. Grinding is minimal, and I only did it when I just felt like bashing some heads in for fun.Get it. Get it, now!

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 13, 2015
												Epic Battle Fantasy 4 - The first thing that popped into my head when I heard of this game was, "what kind of name is that?" Going by the title alone, you almost expect this to be the most cliche RPG ever, and it is - in a good way.EBF4 is a bit of a parody of RPGs. You have turn based combat, level ups, and gear, just like in all your normal RPGs. You've also got characters that crack jokes at their own game, and much like the little indie game EvoLand, it likes to make reference to other games fairly often as you bash enemies over the head with oversized weapons.At first glance, this game looks like the kind of flash game you'd play in your internet browser when you were little - the art is colorful but looks primitive and the controls aren't complex. Yet this is the kind of 'flash game' that someone poured hours and hours into, and it shows; the art style may very well be simple, but that's before considering how much you can customize your characters. Each and every helm in the game gives the characters a different hairstyle, for one - heck, I spent more time than I'd like to admit mixing and matching outfits to see what was both stylish and combat practical.The game is very lax in terms of its rules. It could almost be said that it got rid of all the little bits that make RPGs frustrating - encounters are not random, running away is penalty free, all gear is useable once upgraded, grinding is not necessary (except maybe for Epic mode) and upgrade ingredients are plentiful. The game doesn't have you trecking an hour to get a single ingredient - everything progresses at a quick and painless pace.Make no mistake, the game is challenging on Hard and Epic modes. One's ability to arm characters with the right attacks and gear is mandatory for taking on the game's big bosses, even if said big bosses look too comical to take seriously.Overall, a very pleasant game, and there's no way I can't recommend it. It's not the kind of gripping story about trust and betrayal that will move you to tears, but it's a fun little title that does everything right, and should be recognized for it.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 16, 2014
												Eh.I liked EBF3 better.I've been following this game series for a long time now, so when EBF3 came out it 'wowed' me in a way that EBF4 simply cannot - being that it's exactly the same game, but with a new character (who doesn't add to the max count of players on the field). It feels like a new game. But, at the same time, I suppose instead of innovating, it's simply... more content. Coupled with a map that's of a decent size, yet feels surprisingly small. That, and of all the swords that we've got still in the game even from EBF1, no Soul Eater. My absolute favourite sword is not here. That makes me a very sad cookie. Soul Eater, featured in every game up until but excepting this one. Very fun because of the drastic reduction in survivability stats, but a huge increase in damage.I'm only 17 hours in, at the final boss, and I expect to be here for a while longer, simply because I'm gonna need to grind up a whole bunch more XP off... something, and a whole bunch more money, off... something, since I expect I am going to need a pile of it to upgrade every piece of equipment I need so I can finally beat the boss.Now let's get something straight. I don't mind grinding. I play Disgaea 1. Yeah, play. Not played. I'm still going.But in EBF4... for some reason, I'm not really enjoying the grinding. I'm not really certain why. I spent hours upon hours finishing up EBF3, and it was incredibly satisfying to finally tick every box, but with EBF4, I'm struggling to work up the effort to beat the final boss.Why do I recommend this game?I recommend it because it's a good game. It really is. It's a $12 JRPG-type game, it's great fun, and it's terribly, wonderfully simple in scope. It's exactly what it looks like, a turn-based JRPG. If you like turn-based JRPGs, you will like this one.If your finger is hovering over that 'Add To Cart' button, and you're just not sure, then give Epic Battle Fantasy 3 a go. It's free, and a good representation of what you're going to find if you purchase EBF4.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												Quite enjoyable, and very nostalgic as I had played the previous three installments which were flash games. Reminiscent of the RPGs of old, with unique new twists. Offers an arcadey experience with a plot as intricate as the Mario franchise, so you don't really need to worry about getting caught up or anything since anywhere you start is pretty much all you really need to know.Like I said, a very arcade experience for those who want good, strategic combat out of their RPGs. Multiple difficulty levels which can be changed outside of combat. Alot of the game will be you having epic combat in a fantasy setting, but I suppose the title could have told you that much.This game gives plenty of replay value, despite the 28 hours I clocked in at the time of this review, I haven't finished a single playthrough yet. Provided, I did alot of mucking about with sidequesting and took my sweet time, and if I went straight for the final boss things could have been done quicker, but this game features a whole host of battles that aren't part of the main map and further enhances the whole "arcade" view point.Although, by no means is this game tedious just because you fight things alot; the main focus of the game is RPG combat, as referenced by the title, and it delivers.People have said there's a free flash version of this game, and there is; but it doesn't include the content this has. Said content is the particuarly large "Battle Mountain" portion which has a HUGE amount of content, and this version supports up to three newgame+ runs, with enemies scaling with player level each NG+. This also runs better than the flash version, which is a given due to being a stand alone client now. The dev also did a good job with the previous three flash installments, so why not show him a little love? Alternatively, you could purchase the "full verison" on kongregate and play it there, but I feel that's less optimal. It's cheaper, but it's still going to be in flash there and ultimately not as Despite not having a indepth story, which isn't a bad thing mind you, the characters were still interesting to me. Graphics are pleasantly cartoony and colorful, with lots of detail and style.Also, unlike the flash version, this has cloud saving, so temporary internet file shenanigans won't muck anything up.Also features comedy and good times!Ultimately, this was a good buy. I forget whether I got this on sale or not, but looking at the price I'd call it worthy of twelve dollars. On the other hand, I am a real scrooge, so I prefer to save as much money as possible when I buy things.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 2, 2016
												Epic Battle Fantasy 4 despite its quirks is a reasonably well made JRPG with a solid combat system that comes with interesting itemization(optimization for fights ahoy!). Sadly I found the story rather lacking. Obviously it makes fun of many stereotypes in the genre and overal tries to make jabs at how easy our heroes mow through zones while npc's pretend like it's all ever so hard...In the end I cannot help but feel that the lack of any kind of story to get invested into really hurts the game since it really only has the gameplay going for it. When a serious game makes a joke or two you can really appreciate them since they contrast with the serious nature of the game. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 sadly makes a joke out of everything which ends up making everything unfunny. So is the game worth playing? I bought it for about €3,00 or so and I'd say the 25 hours I got out of it were easily worth it. Get it at a discount and you'll have fun without trying to justify the price. I enjoyed the game since it has solid combat and itemization but it's not going to be something people will talk about much since storytelling is often such a strong part of JRPG's and it simply hurts the game not having much of any.

												First and foremost, this is essentially an upgraded flash game. If you dont want to pay full price (which is understandable for some people) then wait for a sale.This game brings back the classic feel of a turn based rpg system in a warm, fun filled cartoony format. It is not a childish kind of fun, but is still best left to those who like games that are not even close to serious and are meant to just screw around with. That being said, it is possible to either breeze through the storyline or sit and grind for god knows how long on achievements. Either one works.If anyone were to ask me if this game is worth getting, I'd respond with "Do you like cheesy, fun games that arent at all serious? If so then yes."

content:
Posted: January 21
												I have played through and enjoyed all three other Epic Battle Fantasy games, and i enjoyed the series. Sure, it's not the best or most complex game, but the skillsets and itemsets and the way the combat work are grippingly fun and highly strategic, and the enemies were interesting the whole way through.That is, until this one.The game now no longer lets you win by strategy and you can't use the team you want. Unless you find the secret items or buy the exact ones which you have to use for each specific fight, and then GRIND until max level, you literally cannot win without turning down the difficulty at which point you may as well not play the game, because the story isn't gripping or interesting in the slightest.If you're thinking of buying this game, play Epic Battle Fantasy 3 for free instead, i wouldn't even pay £5 for this let alone it's actual asking price.

number of helpful: 12 of 53 people (23%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												I bought this game due to the large number of positive reviews, but frankly, I'm not impressed. The combat mechanics are competent, but there's nothing that distinguishes it from any other turn based RPG. Furthermore, the game isn't particularly difficult, so it never feels like your choice of skills or equipment really matters, since you'll be able to beat any enemy without much hassle anyway.The puzzles are pretty standard "find key/item to unlock area," or "flip X switches," or "push this boulder out of the way" affairs that are quite easy to solve.The humor and plot are comically childish and shallow, to the point where I was questioning if the story was written to be intentionally terrible. But perhaps I'm not part of the intended audience; I just can't imagine anyone over the age of 12 finding the humor or story compelling.

"                 " disabling cloud saves, searching for all instances of EBF4option files.3. compat. mode = windows 74. compat. mode = windows xp sp25. 												The actual gameplay itself minus the characters and the dialogue was decent, but nothing special. I liked the style - everything is adorable, but that was quickly detracted from by other aspects of the game.If I could eliminate the girl with the jiggly boobs from the game completely I might have sat through more of it.  Jiggle physics/animations completely belong in some games (saints row hilarity anyone?)- in this game I found boobs in my face uneccessary and eventually it just ruined it for me. There is always the option to swap characters, but the damage was already done. I also remember many points with the dialogue where I stopped and thought "wow... I can't believe I actually paid money for this", doubtful I'll go back and finish this game.Overall - 4/10 would reccommend for a pre-teen boy.

number of helpful: 64 of 296 people (22%) found this review helpful9 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 24, 2015
												I feel like this game is exactly what happens when a two-year-old Redditer or /b/-tard gets a hold of RPGMaker. The game tries to pass itself off as funny, witty, and clever, but "meme-based" humor and party members with half of their entire dialogue written in "l33t-sp3@k" simply is not funny. Or enjoyable. Or entertaining. Or anything other than "annoying." It all feels painfully forced, tedious, and failed to get even so much as a giggle out of me. Then the game introduced the Black-Mage-type/offensive spellcaster, Ms. Fanservice, whose special ability is a "sexy wink" and I gave up on this atrocity altogether.The only good thing I have to say about it is it's turn-based battle-system is kinda fun and it was really the only time when I enjoyed myself in the game. However that does absolutely nothing to set it apart from all the other RPGs out there and in the end this game is not something I would recommend to anyone. Ever.

content:
Posted: July 18, 2014
												I love RPGs. Jrpgs, western rpgs, they're both awesome.I saw the trailer for this game, read some reviews, and I was sold.Unfortunately, my first (and last) impression of the game was so bad, that I regret having paid for this title.The interface is terribly cluttered, difficult to use and understand.There is NO tutorial in the beginning. None. There are some vague hints here and there about minor aspects of the game, but that's it.How to fight? How to find your way? How to manage your inventory and skills?Not explained in any way. Hell, I even had a hard time figuring out where the hell I was supposed to go to begin with!I'm all for games that don't hold your hand (God bless Dark Souls), but this game, despite being a Jrpg, seemed to make it obscenely hard for me to even start going somewhere.Unless you have the patience of a saint and the willingness to figure where the hell you're supposed to go to, and how to do ANYTHING, I recommend staying away from this title.I regret buying it.

												Pros+ Beautiful animations, from battle scenes to idle animations+ Hours of gameplay+ Changing armor/weapons changes the appearance of the character+ Lots of additional gameplay in the post-game+ Not just about turned-based combat; many puzzles to solve and secrets to find throughout the gameCons- The lack of a serious plot line might bother someOverall score: 10/10I can honestly only say good things about this game. If you don't believe me, you can always play the free version on Kongregate to see if you'd like it. Some of you might be wondering, "Why should I pay for a game I can play for free online?" Here are my two reasons: First, there is a lot of additional gameplay when you buy the version on Steam. It's the same version as the paid version on Kongregate, but this version comes with Steam Trading Cards, which obviously makes it superior. Second, I've been a longtime fan of the series. (My personal favorite is EBF3.) in some ways, I feel like buying this game was thanks to Kupo for all of the hours of fun I spent in all of his games. But seriously, play this game.If you like turn based RPGs, this game will be perfect for you. The animations are beautiful, and the gameplay draws a lot from the Final Fantasy series. I also love how armor, weapons, and accessories called flairs affect the appearance of characters. It's a personal pet peeve of mine when RPGs have armor, but changing the equipped armor doesn't change what the character is wearing. You can see that a lot of effort went into this game.The game doesn't take itself too seriously, so don't expect to be blown away by the plot. There are some immature jokes as well. Neither of these bothered me, but in fairness to the other games I reviewed, I felt obligated to list a con.Regardless, EBF4 is a wonderful game and you should definitely buy it if you like turn-based RPGs.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												This game sat on my wishlist for quite some time while I hemmed and hawwed over whether or not I wanted to buy it.  Reviews were good, I've just had a not-so-great streak of games I've tried out lately.  But I figured what the heck, it looks like something I might like.And let me tell you, it is!  This is a light-hearted 2D old-school style RPG that makes light and silly fun of many of the tropes we all know and love when it comes the the RPGs we've all played over the years.The gameplay is very simple to learn, but you do sit and strategize a little bit when it comes to the attacks you want to use and what to equip for the best results.  It is very forgiving and easy to pick up for the casual player, you can save at any point you want and there is no rush.  You can go back an unlock previous areas you've been to for more exploration or items.And of the items, there are a great many in this game.  You will find an upgadeable crafting system here based largely upon random drops from enemies and chests.  There are also some that you can buy.  Weapons and armor are all fairly unique in the things they do an attirbutes that they have.This game doesn't do anything especially new or different.  It is a comfortable and well-executed little game that you can sink hours into without realizing it has gotten dark out and you ought to make dinner or at least let the dog outside.The $12 full price is not bad, I felt it was a reasonable cost for the game.  But if you can pick it up on sale for less, I highly recommend you do if any of the above rings your bell.

Beautiful animations, great bosses, and fantastic Limit Breaks.While at first it may seem like a cookie-cutter RPG, this Flash game has things that other RPGs fail to deliver. The characters are - admittedly lecherous - but lovable, the storyline is satirical and fun, and quite obviously, the game doesn't take itself too seriously; all the reason why this game is suited for children and teenagers alike.If you're like me, and want a challenging experience whilst chuckling at the jokes and smiling at the anime references, then EBF4 is for you. NOTE: After playing this game you most certainly will hate cats with a burning passion.

												Although it isn’t the best RPG I’ve ever played, it is still worth buying. The graphics and music for the game are both excellent. The gameplay for the battle system is really fun. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 7, 2015
												This game is a joke, being a parody of Final Fantasy,BUTIt's not a joke.Not only does this include a difficulty system that actually tells you everything major that changes (Besides things like the Bomb Slimes and Purple Squids entering battle with nine poison stacks on Epic) but the game is still reasonably difficult without putting it on Epic, unless you're so used to Epic that in your second playthrough on on a sequential save half of the enemies one-shotting you in the power plant due to you being two levels underleveled feels normal. My first experience with Epic was nearly getting killed on the first battle in the game, gg. What truly makes this game difficult is Epic is insanely hard, but you can adapt to it. You can get hit by the enemies and survive, and most things that the enemies can do aren't out of your power, unlike a lot of games you see today. It puts the player and the enemies on nearly equal ground, but manages to still keep the game reasonably difficult. That is a sign that the game's difficulty is well designed.This game contains parodic references to almost every game in the book that your childhood was composed of. My favorite cluster of references is the graveyard in Graybone Cemetery, there are many tombstones on one screen, a few of them are damaged, but the ones that aren't contain jokes that are mostly references of some sort. This is only a pinch of what is included in the actual game, though. The dialogue in this game somehow keeps a decent balance between "Absolutely hilarious and cannot be taken seriously" and "Deep storyline" despite the final boss being *SPOILER* a cat god.I think my favorite thing about the dialogue in this game is either the fact that there is a one-liner for nearly every skill in the game, or the fact that dialogue can randomly trigger when walking around the map, and these times it's at it's funniest. There is one cluster of dialogue where Lance is staring at highschoolers and Natalie calls him a pedophile. Another is a conversation between Matt and Lance where Matt seems to be trying to explain to Lance that despite all the cameras he apparently has in his posession that he uses to stalk Natalie, it's still stalking and over the top stalking at that. The items even get some of this amazing humor, every one having a one-liner for a description. Achievements even get thrown into this bucket, there is one that nearly everyone knows about for clicking Natalie's boobs.The only negative that comes to mind is the lack of an optimized full screen resolution and no access to STEAM features ingame, besides syncing, achievements, and cards. However this is understandable for a game ported from flash.There isn't much to say about art style, it's not super duper flashy, and it definitely doesn't try to be edgy. It just tries to be cartoonish, cute, and funny, as it should. I can't say much about the music, purely because music is almost never my main focus. Although I can say the music is definitely catchy and worth listening too, HFX definitely did a good job in my opinion.This game has very nice replayability too, but the story isn't really the strong suit. I personally replay for the comedy and the challenge, and I do NG+ to get gear and etc. I didn't grab the first time around. Overall, Matt deserves much more attention than he gets, but should never stop being a semi-solo developer. When you work with a lot of people and publishers, games like this are only dreams.
