												First old school type JRPG i've played in a VERY long time, and it made me remember why I liked them so much.  Lots of options and depth to the game in terms of elements/stats/effects/gear, and the fact that you can make the 4 characters into almost any type of class you wants negates the fact that there's no real character variety.  The one real downside I will say is that the storyline and comedy really wasn't there for me.  Maybe some spots where it made me smile, but nothing resembling laughter or really funny moments.  Worth the purchase for the one play thru, plus if you like it a lot there's plenty to do after that like endless modes, marathon battles, and epic difficulty.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2016
												Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a fantastic RPG game that is very enjoyable for several reasons, of which include the large amount of customization that offers thousands of strategies, and the addition of destroying a whole lot of enemies. The aptly Battle Mountain contains battles that will test your strength, and reward you. I enjoy the series, and this installment is just about the very best so far, at least until Epic Battle Fantasy 5 comes out. If you enjoy a fun RPG game that isn't too serious, lots of ways to obliterate your foes and just a plain good time, this is the right game for you. Of course, the interface is not the easiest to navigate, and the lack of a tutorial is a bit messed-up, but before you try this game, you should try the Flash version of it, to see if you would want to spend money on it.

												I honestly could not stress how much I recommend this game to RPG enthusiasts. I played the Epic Battle Fantasy series when it was just an evolving flash series (with a really fun bullet hell offshoot) on Kongregate. I loved each and every iteration, and I loved EBF4 to the point I sat down and went full nerd-out on it with writing things down, calculating, minmaxing, the whole nerd-works. I loved it enough I actually put money towards the microtransaction it had. When I heard it was coming to Steam, I was super hype for it, but I never was able to get around to snatching it. Now that I have it, i've revisited it and am having just as much fun - if not more! - than I was on Kongregate. The game itself is what I would call a tribute parody. The entire thing is self-aware of its genre, but also faithful to what it's parodying. Classic turn based combat with a rock-paper-scissors elemental / buff / debuff system, many items to equip to this end, a buttload of spells and abilities both natural to each character AND others that can be passed between each. Saving on the fly, resuming on the fly, overworld monster encounters instead of the random encounters we all are used to from classic RPGs, and those monsters tend to disappear permanently if they areb locking your main path. The scanbot allows you quick reference mid-battle to what an enemy is capable of, while also giving you a permanent bestiary entry for later reference. There are plenty of other features that really speak that an RPG enthusiast is behind the development, who has gone through the caveats and annoying nuances that many RPGs over the years have tossed at us that plenty a gamer have thrown their hands up at in rage. There is an abundance of humor, including puns, references, tropes and similar things that make fun of itself and its genre, and also referring to other games, series, memes, etc. without being overbearing and causing you to roll your eyes. tl;dr: This is an RPG made by, and for, RPG lovers, and I could honestly say you're missing out if you pass this up and are an avid player of RPGs.

												Very tight combat mechanics with a lot of interacting skills, status effects, and equipment.  The depth of customization here is stupendous. Not exactly crysis, but it doesn't want to be, and it fits the feel of the game perfectly.The dialogue is humorous - adolescent and boob-focused, but again, this game doesn't care about that and neither should you.  It knows what it wants to be and does it great.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												I've been a fan of the Epic Battle Fantasy since I first found the original on Newgrounds five years ago. Seeing the series evolve as much as it has, finally reaching an actual release on Steam? It's a great sight.I've never been a fan of JRPGs, but I never found EBF to be frustratingly difficult. It requires the right enough amount of micromanagement, planning, and strategy to appeal to both casual and hardcore RPG players. It's also got a very parody-minded sense of humor that's usually quite fun and rarely runs dry. One example in it's favor is South Park: The Stick of Truth, which I did like for it's humor, but the tongue-in-cheek delivery kind of killed it for me halfway. EBF doesn't do that, and I'm glad about that.While my only real complaint would be the relative lack of backstory to cover the events of past games for those who might be new to these games, it's never so drawn out and overly complicated to not pick up on quickly. If you're looking for a new RPG to add to your library, I'd definitely make no higher recommendations.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 21, 2014
												A unique, well-thought-out RPG featuring a classic battle systesm. With 4 difficulty options that can be swapped at any time, the game has appeal to all fans of the genre, whether you're a hardcore power leveler or just rushing through the mandatory battles, the combat is simple and with many skills to level at your command, battles become more reliant on your own decisions. The dialog both in combat and in the field is witty and surprisingly well written, though some dialogues can be misplaced if missed in an earlier fight. The art in the game is fantastic - the character and enemy models are well-drawn and all have a distinct EBF artstyle. Each piece of equipment modifies the character models enabling the player to decide what their character stats will be and cool or cute they look. The story mode is fairly lengthy, taking anywhere from 15-25 hours on a normal difficulty run depending on completion and grind and features several optional challenges, with massive replayability including New Game + and Battle Island. Last but not least the music, by HalcyonicFalconX is not only great, but each piece fits amazingly with the nature of the battle or field, making the entire RPG experience phenomenal.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 21, 2014
												So Captain, what's your opinion on this game?...Huh? Sorry, I was too busy playing EBF4.Anywho, EBF4 is an RPG where you control 4 characters but you only have 3 at once. That 4th character is your backup, so you're thinking "Oh I have to take a turn to switch out and now it's going to get mulched by the enemy, great." but nope! Totally free, just take that action and you can still attack! (You can do this multiple times as well...for fun I suppose?) That's the thing with this game, it leaves out all the bull**** (Pardon my French) and leaves all the fun, such as no random encounters. But doesn't that make the game too easy? Ha ha, no. If the game is too easy, you can easily take on the upgraded bosses in the bonus stages but the normal bosses are hard enough. Considering that I always make sure to be two levels above the current boss's level, it's easy for me but I figure if I didn't do that, it'd be a challenge. A fair challenge, but a challenge nonetheless. The game is exciting and fun to play, there's always things to look out for such as hidden items, enjoyable character banter (Your mileage may vary, obviously), and so much more. It's only 5 bucks due to the sale but if it was priced on merit, I'd say it be 40-50$, 60$ would be stretching it but for a game like this, I sure won't mind coughing up the dosh for it!

content:
Posted: February 22, 2015
												This is not your ordinary game. This game is fun. This game is indeed an epic fantasy of battles.This is a tale of three cities: Greenleaf, Whitefall and Goldenbrick. One day, a ranger from Greenleaf - a girl named Anna - woke up to the most horrible sight: the sacred jewel was missing. For about a year, a team made up of a pirate-samurai, his red mage female partner, an ex-Nazish gun aficando and their limbless cat had wandered the land, pilfering their way through. To be honest, this sort of unscrupulous behavior was mainly because they had defeated an elder demon the previous year, and most of the world owed them a few favors - begrudgingly, perhaps - and really didn't mind. Anna's mind instantly wandered over to this group of heroes, and set out in search of them...

												It's a great game. I've played all of the Epic Battle Fantasy games, and this one is my favorite. Despite my dislike of uncouth humor (and there is quite a bit of uncouth humor), I find this game to be quite enjoyable. And there is also humor that I do like, so there's that. There's more content here than you can get play in any short period of time.It's a FInal Fantasy-esque game, so if you are familiar with that, it is easy enough to figure out. Click on this, click on that, enemies get exploded/shot/sliced/arrow'd/. Level up skills with skill points. Use items. If I were to make one complaint, it would be that it doesn't have a Mac version. The dev said that it won't be happening for a while, so if you don't have a Windows computer, you might be out of luck.Matt does, in fact, like swords. Even if they aren't actually swords.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2015
												This, in my opinion is an awesome game.Nice atmosphere, the graphics soothe the eyes, and overall, the humor is just enjoyable.Now, there are people on here who would dare give negative reviews about this game, calling it childish, or just terrible, and that might just shake your decision on whether to buy this game or not.There's a solution for that: There IS a free version of this game, but it lacks a certain replayability that the premium (this one) version does. So you could go try that and decide for yourself if you want to buy this game and support the maker at the same time.Heck, or even try the prequel you can find for free online as well! Or even the rest of the series! All the way from Epic Battle Fantasy (the first one). Though the game plays more like an exploratory RPG from the third game forth.So why would you buy this game if you can play the free version online? Well, in my personal opinion, it just doesn't feel complete unless if you have the entire thing. Like the Battle Mountain, where you can test your abilities, skills, and equipment against some of the most difficult enemies in the game despite your level or difficulty. I also followed the creator's games ever since Epic Battle Fantasy 2 came out on Newgrounds and just want to support him and his works. And also I wanted to make my achievements public because I'm like that.Also you'll be a filthy casual if you don't.

Posted: September 25, 2015
												It's a very good game for it's price if you don't take it too seriously. The game is very easy (specially if you compare it to some old rpgs) but the gameplay is fun with no random encounters (you can still powerlevel by leaving the area and coming back).It has a simple UI, easy to understand and allows you to battle faster than in other turn-based rpgs.Nice crafting system, very simple but effective, only really needed to play on max difficulty (where you get most steam achievements)Don't expect too much from the storyline though.Fun game overall to spend some hours. (I'd recomend using some sort of speedhack like in most rpgs if you plan on powerleveling)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 8, 2015
												Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is easily one of my most favorite games I have played. It has over 72 hours worth of game play(which is becoming more rare in newer games) and four difficulties for even further challenge. There are many skills you can learn in the game and some are character specific while some can be learned buy multiple characters to add strategy to the game. In addition to many skills, there are many different types of equipment, each with their own special effect and stats. Aside from the excellent game play, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 has great music that really sets the tone for the game in each area. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is definetely worth the $12 since most games that have 24+ hours gameplay cost 5+ times as much. Very excited that the developer will be making an Epic Battle Fantasy 5. Will definetely buy that when it comes out.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
												In a sentence: Simple, but tons of fun. It's a basic RPG in the old school turn-based style, but a well-crafted one and full of charm. Great entry point for those inexperienced in turn-based JRPGs and curious to try them out, because of it's simplicity: Everything about the game is easy to grasp and satisfying to master. The combat and customization will never get you lost and yet decisions are not entirely brainless, the exploration is rewarding and backtracking never feels like a chore, the level and grinding curve is done just right. Seasoned veterans of the RPG genre may find it too basic, and they'd be right, but even them can find something to love about this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												I've been a fan of the Epic Battle Fantasy since I first found the original on Newgrounds five years ago. Seeing the series evolve as much as it has, finally reaching an actual release on Steam? It's a great sight.I've never been a fan of JRPGs, but I never found EBF to be frustratingly difficult. It requires the right enough amount of micromanagement, planning, and strategy to appeal to both casual and hardcore RPG players. It's also got a very parody-minded sense of humor that's usually quite fun and rarely runs dry. One example in it's favor is South Park: The Stick of Truth, which I did like for it's humor, but the tongue-in-cheek delivery kind of killed it for me halfway. EBF doesn't do that, and I'm glad about that.While my only real complaint would be the relative lack of backstory to cover the events of past games for those who might be new to these games, it's never so drawn out and overly complicated to not pick up on quickly. If you're looking for a new RPG to add to your library, I'd definitely make no higher recommendations.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
												I was looking for a game to stray away from my action RPG binge in the last few weeks. I wanted something easy to play and comedic. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 was my pick.This game concept is very interesting. It borrows a lot from the classical JRPGs of the old days, but it also adds its own flavor to the mix. The graphics are unique and are based on Flash animations, similar to lots of web games, which I loved.The dialogue, and the battle system, is filled with humor, dark humor, internet humor, memes, references to classical JRPGs, etc.This game was designed for internet-savvy audience to enjoy it. There is a lot to love about this game.I never played the previous games in this series, however, I can not wait to see what is next. I am striving to have a 100% achievement score on this one. This feeling is similar to when I used to play Pokemon, and gotta catch'em all vibe, it was tedious to do yet fun and we wanted to do it. EBF4 is definitely in that category of games. Players will not only enjoy its humor and battle system, but also will enjoy being completionists.I recommend this game to any RPG, JRPG, humor, internet, and anime fans. All of you will enjoy it.P.S.The "Pervert" achievement was the best!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 23, 2014
												Having only played one of the prequels without even finishing it I don't feel adequate enough to write a review for it, but I will because I think it really deserves one.For being a flash game, it really does a lot of things very well. It has a bunch of content and the feel of the game and combat offers more replay value than most other games. I'm positive there's some kind of overpowered gear/party setup to be found somewhere/sometime but as far as I have seen there is the complexity where switching equipment to counteract the zones you're currently in will benefit you considerably which is great. It should not be mistaken for an easy game other than being an RPG where you can farm/outlevel zones, because the highest difficulty setting does offer quite a challenge.There's a whole lot of fun to be had with just the humorous dialogues and references to popular video games and anime culture. If that's not your thing, then you may want to seek elsewhere. The game may run a little bit slower during intense scenes where there's a lot happening on the screen (depending on your graphic settings) but other than that, the only downside I can possibly imagine is feeling a bit disconnected with the story if you haven't played the previous games.. though in my opinion, even that can be nullified because the story is quite bonkers to begin with.The game can be played for free, but the Steam version does offer a lot more extra content. Whether that's worth the price is subject to personal opinion, but I think the sheer awesomeness of the included soundtrack by the great music artist (and another personal favorite) HalcyonicFalconX definitely makes up for it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 25, 2016
												I recommend the entire Epic Battle Fantasy series, especially this one and Epic Battle Fantasy 3, almost solely on the wit that Matt Roszak put in these turn-based RPG games.Epic Battle Fantasy 4 introduces a new character to the party in the previous installment. It also adds even more humorous wit, clever allusions and references, and allegory that sets EBF apart from other RPGs. It plays like an RPG: you have a party; you can select which enemies on the world map to attack; you collect equipment, items (coffee to revive dead players, pizza and other foodstuffs to restore health, etc.), and gold ("chocolate coins"); and you beat bosses. Any more details would be spoilers, so play it for yourself!Play the previous games first (they're free on various online game portals) to get the story, but don't miss out on EBF4, which is too clever to pass on.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
												In a sentence: Simple, but tons of fun. It's a basic RPG in the old school turn-based style, but a well-crafted one and full of charm. Great entry point for those inexperienced in turn-based JRPGs and curious to try them out, because of it's simplicity: Everything about the game is easy to grasp and satisfying to master. The combat and customization will never get you lost and yet decisions are not entirely brainless, the exploration is rewarding and backtracking never feels like a chore, the level and grinding curve is done just right. Seasoned veterans of the RPG genre may find it too basic, and they'd be right, but even them can find something to love about this game.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2016
												Best RPG combat system I've played in my life (have played about 40 RPGs). This game is not easy and you really have to think and understand it to play on harder difficulties (and you must min-max to win on hardest), but you can enjoy lower difficulty without much thought if you prefer to just have fun. About 50-100 hours of content. Fun and detailed art style, TONS of personality, a lot of scenario variety, and lots of humor.  I haven't had this much fun playing an RPG since I was a kid playing FFX. I cannot recommend this game highly enough. I strongly suggest you stop reading, buy this game (small file-size) and if for some reason you aren't wholly, ridiculously and entirely entertained... well, you can just refund it then (unlikely scenario).

												One of the best RPG games I have played.I had originally played the online Kongregate version way before the Steam version released. Everything from the characters to the anime references and memes are memorable. Addicting.Cons: The challenges imposed by Battle Mountain may be too rigourous for some, and that could lead to frustration (also, the final boss, lol). But other than that, I cannot seem to find any other bad things about this game.

content:
Posted: December 25, 2015
												Let me start by saying it's definitely not worth full price, this just doesn't have enough content over the free version that's been available for years to be worth anywhere near $10. I got it for about $2.50 and at that price I heartily recommend it. Anyone who likes turn based fights like FF or Pokemon will enjoy this. The humor isn't bad although there are a lot of running jokes from the previous games, so if you're not into the series you probably won't be into this. 100% achievements in 25 hours pretty damn good for a flash game. Only downsides are some performance issues due to being flash (usually can be fixed with a restart) and low replayability once you've done everything in the game once. NG+ is more of a grind for an achievement than a chance to play around with early enemies with end game skills and gear since the enemies scale with you from start to finish.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												I've been a fan of the Epic Battle Fantasy since I first found the original on Newgrounds five years ago. Seeing the series evolve as much as it has, finally reaching an actual release on Steam? It's a great sight.I've never been a fan of JRPGs, but I never found EBF to be frustratingly difficult. It requires the right enough amount of micromanagement, planning, and strategy to appeal to both casual and hardcore RPG players. It's also got a very parody-minded sense of humor that's usually quite fun and rarely runs dry. One example in it's favor is South Park: The Stick of Truth, which I did like for it's humor, but the tongue-in-cheek delivery kind of killed it for me halfway. EBF doesn't do that, and I'm glad about that.While my only real complaint would be the relative lack of backstory to cover the events of past games for those who might be new to these games, it's never so drawn out and overly complicated to not pick up on quickly. If you're looking for a new RPG to add to your library, I'd definitely make no higher recommendations.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 22
												tl;dr - if you can deal with the performance problems and like JRPGs definitely worth a playthough but expect frequent disruption even on top-end systems.Pros - Good JRPG style game. Includes all the typical trope along with a unique plot (sort of - team up and save the world, JRPG style) and likeable characters. Very fun and funny game, easy to learn and a ton of stuff to do. Decent but not great controls.Cons - None with the content or gameplay. Better controls would be helpful but not a big deal. Only real issue was frequent performance problems (the reason I stopped playing). With no resource pressure game frequently lags during combat and screen transitions. Searching the web, this is a common issue. It's apparently a side effect of translating from a Flash game to an exe and the dev can't do anything about it. The issue becomes increasingly more frustrating as you advance - the longer a fight is, the more frequently you'll see framerate drops or even complete freezes that don't correlate to resource contention. Once you get into long fights (post-endgame content) it's not worth the trouble.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 16
												Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a good, even great, JRPG that nails the Final fantasy style of game in an indie package pretty damn well. First and foremost it´s extremely flashy and looks great thanks to constant lively animations, vibrant colours and a ton of variety. The combat is engaging enough to keep up the pace and as the game progresses one does need to start paying more and more attention to elemental strengths/weaknesses, though it doesn´t get overly complex at any point(at least on the first playthrough).The structure of the game carries it and exploring the world opening treasure chests, new story bits, talking to people and beating some mosnters is blast all the way through. The humour works with some stuff landing, some not but the tone is consistent and enjoyable. That said it´s worth keeping in mind that this is very much a full-blown JRPG first and a comedy-game second. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is both proudly part of the genre and makes fun of the funny parts of it, exaclty as a good comedy-game should be.All and all I couldn´t really recommend this game more for anyone feeling like playing a solid and pretty as hell JRPG

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												A highly polished gem that takes the older Final Fantasy battle system, and does it really right. ProsThe battle system - Highly polished. Enemies can attack in waves. Summoning done in an intelligent way that makes them significantly more useful.Incredibly enemy variety. It seems like nearly every screen in the game introduces new enemies to fight. Plenty of strategy in battlesCharacters CustomizationSecrets are littered throughout the game, if you like collecting items.The characters, although cheesy were enjoyable.ConsThe story, being a parody isn't particularly great, but it's not terrible. I think the ending was a little disappointing.Overall - I give this game a 9/10. If it were made by squeenix, or some other large company I would give it an 8.5/10. It's all around excelllent, and I really enjoyed it. And this game has cats.How can it go wrong?

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 2, 2015
												Epic battle fantasy 4 was actually the best game I've played all year, hands down. Balanced but challenging gameplay, witty humor and a ton of innuendoes all thrown together into one RPG is a once in a lifetime game. I really enjoyed the strategy to it, especially the weapon and armor system. In EBF4, There isnt such thing as endgame armor or weapons. Its all balanced. The sword you start out with on matt will be useful for some battles, but not all. Likewise, a shiny new sword from a hard dungeon might be great at taking out certain foes, but not much else. The same goes for the games armor. Overall I give it a 10/10, and I highly reccomend it. Easily worth the cheap price tag. To be honest I'd say it worth much more. If you like a fun engaging game with a lot of references and jokes, pick it up!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												I've been a fan of the Epic Battle Fantasy since I first found the original on Newgrounds five years ago. Seeing the series evolve as much as it has, finally reaching an actual release on Steam? It's a great sight.I've never been a fan of JRPGs, but I never found EBF to be frustratingly difficult. It requires the right enough amount of micromanagement, planning, and strategy to appeal to both casual and hardcore RPG players. It's also got a very parody-minded sense of humor that's usually quite fun and rarely runs dry. One example in it's favor is South Park: The Stick of Truth, which I did like for it's humor, but the tongue-in-cheek delivery kind of killed it for me halfway. EBF doesn't do that, and I'm glad about that.While my only real complaint would be the relative lack of backstory to cover the events of past games for those who might be new to these games, it's never so drawn out and overly complicated to not pick up on quickly. If you're looking for a new RPG to add to your library, I'd definitely make no higher recommendations.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 23
												The story is silly and funny. It's full of little intenet speech and memes references.The big thing that has me recommend this game though is the combat system. It is hands down one of the single best turn based combat systems I have EVER played. I have been playing RPGs for over 20 years, hundreds of them completed. This not small praise. It's an excellent system.Unlike many RPGs, elemental effects actually matter. Ever single enemy has elemental weaknesses to take advantage of. All your weapons (bar a few non-elemental ones) have elements that deal damage of its type and buff spells of its type.The game actively encourages you to swap equipment mid-combat to take advantage of the situation. Giving yourself over 100% resistance to an element will allow you to be HEALED by that element! More than once I've had all my team with close to, if not over, 100% resistance and the normally very strong enemy deals pathetic amounts of damage.I cannot recommend this enough if you love RPGs and especially love good combat systems.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 19, 2016
												This is a very fun indie RPG.  It's light hearted, cheeky dialogue and enemies are very memorable and endearing.  I've played it through 4 full times and haven't gotten sick of it yet.Pros:- The music is unbelievably good.  Phyrnna (the composer) is up there with the best in the business.  While the game is great, the single most impressive aspect is the music.- The underlying battle system is very well balanced and expansive.  Tons of skills, summons, items, weapons, variety and it also works well.  You don't find yourself having to rely on the same tactic over and over.  Different enemies require different tactics.- The dialogue is really enjoyable.  Many, many hilarious lines in this game.- Nice variety of achievements to add replay value.- Characters have strong personalities and are very unique.  Quite memorable.- Puzzles are fun, not too common and well designed.- The game itself is nicely designed and does a good job of rewarding you for searching for secrets (hidden treasures and stuff, nothing super important)Cons:- Can feel a bit grindy at times especially when you get to the battles that have 3 waves.  Fortunately amazing music is there to take the edge off.- Not enough reason to utilize your 4th character.  It's too easy to just park Lance in the back up slot and never use him.  He's a fun character, but Anna is the better support character since she has access to the party defense up and reflex up buffs.  Lance just can't keep up with her and thus gets overlooked for important battles.Overall:This is unquestionably a fun, well made game.  The game knows what it is trying to be and pulls it off extraordinarily well.  Kupo Games is a one man, independent studio who puts out high quality games at good prices.  For the price, this game is a no brainer.  I couldn't recommend it more strongly!

content:
Posted: February 28
												This is a simple but fun flash game. At the time I was in such a rush to play it as soon as steam put it up for sale I bought it. It is kinda a knock off version of Final Fantasy. It is a turn based game. If you want to buy it go ahead but I would recommend instead save that money for another game, go and find it on some random flash game site and play it for free. It is a game worth playing and if you do choose to buy it it is worth playing but if you can play it for free why not just play it for free.

content:
Posted: March 4
												One of my favourite little Indie RPG's the game has a great artstyle and humor! The gameplay is simple point and click movement what allows for easy movement and although it may seem like its just a lazy RPG it actually presents hours and hours of fun to explore and complete everything possible. Has a great mix of exploration challenge, humor, and also it has plenty of easter eggs and secrets to discover

content:
Posted: April 25
												EBF4 looks like a normal RPG, but isn't. It has witty dialogue which often breaks the fourth wall and there are cats. Lots of cats. Good cats, bad cats, evil cats, helpful cats, cute cats, dead cats, god like cats, dark and evil cats, angelic cats, you get the idea, lots of cats.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 13
												Except for the occasional instadeath attack (which can be easily countered with a certain buff), I've actually come to appreciate this game. As you can see on the video the combat feels nostalgic as in turn-based, deals heavily with element dynamics and has a rather expansive rock paper scissors feel to it.  It wasn't an extremely long adventure but there was a bit of grinding toward the end (If you choose to leave it on hard).  I should mention I got it in a bundle, as that sweetened the deal for me a bit.
